comments: Sweet man who is passionate about Jazz. Can get boring but pls don\'t take out your phone or laptop bc although he won\'t say anything directly to you, he makes comments about how no one pays attention and it\'s rude. You start to feel bad bc you want to pay attention but it\'s hard to sometimes. Easy listening quizzes and gives review sheets for tests

Prof. Lampert is VERY passionate about jazz. I felt bad for him a lot of times b/c many people didn\'t pay attention. You don\'t have to take notes during class but I\'d suggest at least looking at him to show interest. The listening quizzes are easy but u really have to study for the 3 tests. He gives a study guide. No midterm or final. Take him! :)

Prof. Lampert is REALLY passionate about jazz history and is upset that many students don\'t take the class seriously. He will comment on that every so often. Gives few exams but gives a review sheet right before them so you know exactly what\'s on it. Listening quizzes to identify instruments also. Very easy class and so relaxed. Take for sure

Professor Lampert is great. The class really is easy, show up, take notes and you are sure to pass. Listening tests are not at all hard,written tests are true and false and knowing to spell peoples names. Can become boring but is also really interesting. I recommend taking this class for a great grade and to learn about jazz.

This class is full of dates and names, kind of hard to keep track of it all if you don\'t properly pay attention. If you aren\'t a music major, or don\'t really care about jazz history, this class will be boring. Only bright points about this class was no outside work, easy listening quizzes, and he\'s a pretty chill guy.
Great professor, really knows his stuff and is extremely passionate about jazz. Easy listening quizzes and the exams are fair. I would recommend him.

Awesome professor! What could be better than listening to awesome music? Easy listening quizzes and tests on material learned in class. He is so passionate and is a jazz musician, so you can learn a whole lot if you want! Also, really good looking!
History of Jazz: Before 1950. Pretty easy class. No papers, projects, or other assignments. Just show up to class and study for the tests.

As long as you don\'t cause a disturbance in his class you should be fine. no textbooks, papers, or assignments. Just take lecture notes and study for tests. going to have to be able to recognize specific instruments for listening quizzes too
He\'s really into his subject and loves jazz! But this makes it easy to listen to his lectures b/c he is so passionate! Tests are easy too. No projects.

Prof. Lampert is very nice. although he does talk quickly, he\'s very knowledgeable in his subject, and he always welcomes questions. However, his classes have gotten harder. He used to give just two papers and nothing else; instead of the papers, he now gives frequent tests and quizzes. Be sure to pay attention and take notes, and you will do well.

Amazing class, coolest professor I ever had, would take his class every semester if i could. If you respect his class he will reward you, and the music he plays is awesome. I would tell anyone who is interested in Jazz to take the class and listen to the music and about the lives of all the Jazz musicians. You will get an A and LEARN
